00231 int nfs_ParseConfLine(char           *Argv[],
00232                       int             nbArgv,
00233                       char           *line,
00234                       int (          *separator_function) (char),
00235                       int (          *endLine_func) (char))
00236 {
00237         int             output_value = 0;
00238         int             endLine = FALSE;
00239 
00240         char           *p1 = line;      /* Pointeur sur le debut du token */
00241         char           *p2 = NULL;      /* Pointeur sur la fin du token   */
00242 
00243     /* iteration and checking for array bounds */
00244         for ( ; output_value < nbArgv; )
00245     {
00246 
00247       if (*p1 == '\0')
00248         return output_value;
00249 
00250       /* Je recherche le premier caractere valide */
00251       for (; *p1 == ' ' || *p1 == '\t'; p1++);
00252 
00253 
00254       /* p1 pointe sur un debut de token, je cherche la fin */
00255       /* La fin est un blanc, une fin de chaine ou un CR    */
00256       for (p2 = p1; !separator_function(*p2) && !endLine_func(*p2); p2++);
00257 
00258       /* Possible arret a cet endroit */
00259       if (endLine_func(*p2))
00260         endLine = TRUE;
00261 
00262 
00263       /* je valide la lecture du token */
00264       *p2 = '\0';
00265       strcpy(Argv[output_value++], p1);
00266 
00267       /* Je me prepare pour la suite */
00268       if (!endLine)
00269         {
00270           p2 += 1;
00271           p1 = p2;
00272         } else
00273           return output_value;
00274 
00275     }                   /* for( ; ; ) */
00276     
00277     /* out of bounds */
00278     if ( output_value >= nbArgv ) return -1;
00279     
00280     return -2;
00281     
00282 } /* nfs_ParseConfLine */

00308 static struct hostent * nfs_LookupHostAddr( char *host )
00309 {
00310   struct hostent *output;
00311   unsigned long   hostaddr;
00312   int             length = sizeof(hostaddr);
00313 
00314   struct sockaddr_storage    addrv6 ;
00315   struct sockaddr_in6      * paddrv6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)&addrv6 ;
00316 
00317   /* First try gethhostbyname */
00318   if( ( output = gethostbyname(host) ) == NULL )
00319     {
00320       /* Convert from dotted notation to adddress format */
00321       hostaddr = inet_addr(host);
00322 
00323       /* gethostbyname was of no help, try gethostaddr */
00324       output = gethostbyaddr((char *) &hostaddr, length, AF_INET);
00325     }
00326 
00327 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00328   /* if output == NULL it may be an IPv6 address */
00329   if( output == NULL )
00330    {
00331       if( ( output = gethostbyname2( host, AF_INET6 ) ) == NULL )
00332        {
00333           /* Maybe an address in the ASCII format */
00334           if( inet_pton( AF_INET6,
00335                          host,
00336                          paddrv6->sin6_addr.s6_addr ) )
00337            {
00338               output = gethostbyaddr( paddrv6->sin6_addr.s6_addr,
00339                                       sizeof( paddrv6->sin6_addr.s6_addr ),
00340                                       AF_INET6 ) ; 
00341            } 
00342        }
00343    }
00344 #endif
00345 
00346   return output;
00347 }       /* nfs_LookupHostAddr */
00348 
00372 int nfs_LookupNetworkAddr( char           *host,      /* [IN] host/address specifier */
00373                            unsigned long  *netAddr,   /* [OUT] return address       */
00374                            unsigned long  *netMask)   /* [OUT] return address mask  */
00375 {
00376         int                error = 0 ;
00377   int                compute_mask = TRUE;
00378         struct hostent   * host_ent;
00379         struct netent    * net_ent;
00380         in_addr_t          net_addr;
00381         unsigned long      net_mask;
00382         unsigned long      class;
00383 
00384 
00385         /*
00386          * Initialize local variables.. 
00387          */
00388 
00389         net_mask = 0;
00390         net_ent = NULL;
00391         host_ent = NULL;
00392 
00393         /*
00394          * Check for dotted address notation. 
00395          */
00396 
00397         net_addr = inet_network(host);
00398 
00399         if (net_addr == (in_addr_t)-1)
00400     {
00401       /*
00402        * Not a valid dotted IP address. Check for host name. 
00403        */
00404 
00405       if ((host_ent = gethostbyname(host)) != NULL)
00406         {
00407           /*
00408            * A valid hostname. Just copy the hostent address. 
00409            */
00410 
00411           memcpy(&net_addr, host_ent->h_addr, host_ent->h_length);
00412           compute_mask = FALSE;
00413         } 
00414       else
00415         {
00416           
00417           /*
00418            * Not a valid hostname. Check for a network name. 
00419            */
00420           
00421           net_ent = getnetbyname(host);
00422           if (net_ent == NULL)
00423             {
00424               error = errno;
00425               if (error == 0)
00426                 error = ENOENT;
00427               endnetent();
00428             } 
00429           else
00430             {
00431               net_addr = net_ent->n_net;
00432               endnetent();
00433             }
00434         }
00435     }
00436         /*
00437          * If no error and address is a network address, convert address to
00438          * inaddr format by left justifying, determine the network address
00439          * class, and compute the network mask.  
00440          */
00441 
00442         if (error == 0 && compute_mask)
00443     {
00444 
00445       if ((net_addr & 0xffffff00) == 0)
00446         net_addr <<= 24;
00447       else
00448         if ((net_addr & 0xffff0000) == 0)
00449           net_addr <<= 16;
00450         else
00451           if ((net_addr & 0xff000000) == 0)
00452             net_addr <<= 8;
00453       class = (net_addr & 0xc0000000) >> 30;
00454       switch (class)
00455         {
00456         case 0: /* class A address           */
00457         case 1:
00458           if ((net_addr & 0x00ffffff) == 0)
00459             net_mask = 0xff000000;
00460           else
00461             if ((net_addr & 0x0000ffff) == 0)
00462               net_mask = 0xffff0000;
00463             else
00464               if ((net_addr & 0x000000ff) == 0)
00465                 net_mask = 0xffffff00;
00466           break;
00467         case 2: /* class B address           */
00468           if ((net_addr & 0x0000ffff) == 0)
00469             net_mask = 0xffff0000;
00470           else
00471             if ((net_addr & 0x000000ff) == 0)
00472               net_mask = 0xffffff00;
00473           break;
00474         case 3: /* class C address            */
00475           if ((net_addr & 0x000000ff) == 0)
00476             net_mask = 0xffffff00;
00477           break;
00478         default:
00479           break;
00480         }
00481     }
00482         if (error == 0)
00483     {
00484       if (netAddr != (unsigned long *) NULL)
00485         *netAddr = net_addr;
00486       if (netMask != (unsigned long *) NULL)
00487         *netMask = net_mask;
00488     }
00489         return (error);
00490 } /* nfs_LookupNetworkAddr */
00491 
00501 static int nfs_AddClientsToExportList( exportlist_t   * ExportEntry,
00502                                        int              new_clients_number,
00503                                        char          ** new_clients_name,
00504                                        int              option)
00505 {
00506   int                         i = 0 ;
00507   int                         j = 0 ;
00508   unsigned int                l = 0 ;
00509   char                      * client_hostname;
00510   struct hostent            * hostEntry;
00511   exportlist_client_entry_t * p_clients;
00512   int                         is_wildcarded_host = FALSE ;
00513   unsigned long               netMask;
00514   unsigned long               netAddr;
00515   int                         error;
00516   char           __attribute__(( __unused__ ))             FunctionName[] = "nfs_AddClientsToExportList";
00517     
00518   /*
00519    * Notifying the export list structure that another option is to be
00520    * handled 
00521    */
00522   ExportEntry->options |= option;
00523   
00524   /* How many clients are there in the ExportEntry ? */
00525   j = ExportEntry->clients.num_clients;
00526     
00527   p_clients = ExportEntry->clients.clientarray ;
00528   
00529   if ( p_clients == NULL ) 
00530     return ENOMEM ;
00531 
00532         /* It's now time to set the information related to the new clients */
00533         for (i = j; i < j + new_clients_number; i++)
00534     {
00535       /* cleans the export entry */
00536       memset( &p_clients[i], 0, sizeof( exportlist_client_entry_t ) );
00537 
00538       
00539       netMask = 0;      /* default value for a host */
00540       client_hostname = new_clients_name[i - j];
00541 
00542       /* Set client options */
00543       p_clients[i].options |= option;
00544 
00545       /* using netdb to get information about the hostname */
00546       if( client_hostname[0] == '@' )
00547         {
00548           
00549           /* Entry is a netgroup definition */
00550           strncpy( p_clients[i].client.netgroup.netgroupname, (char *)(client_hostname + 1), MAXHOSTNAMELEN ) ;
00551           
00552           p_clients[i].options |= EXPORT_OPTION_NETGRP ;
00553           p_clients[i].type = NETGROUP_CLIENT ;
00554           
00555 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                    
00556           printf("----------------- %s to netgroup %s\n",(option==EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT ? "Root-access":"Access"), p_clients[i].client.netgroup.netgroupname );
00557 #endif          
00558         }
00559       else if ((hostEntry = nfs_LookupHostAddr(client_hostname)) != NULL)
00560         {
00561 
00562           /* Entry is a hostif */
00563           if( hostEntry->h_addrtype == AF_INET )
00564            {
00565              memcpy( &(p_clients[i].client.hostif.clientaddr), hostEntry->h_addr, hostEntry->h_length);
00566              p_clients[i].type = HOSTIF_CLIENT ;          
00567                  
00568 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                    
00569              printf("----------------- %s to client %s = %d.%d.%d.%d\n",(option==EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT ? "Root-access":"Access"), 
00570                  client_hostname, (unsigned int)(p_clients[i].client.hostif.clientaddr >> 24),
00571                  (unsigned int)((p_clients[i].client.hostif.clientaddr >> 16)&0xFF),
00572                  (unsigned int)((p_clients[i].client.hostif.clientaddr >> 8)&0xFF),
00573                  (unsigned int)(p_clients[i].client.hostif.clientaddr & 0xFF));
00574 #endif          
00575           }
00576          else
00577           {
00578              /* IPv6 address */
00579              memcpy( &(p_clients[i].client.hostif.clientaddr6), hostEntry->h_addr, hostEntry->h_length);
00580              p_clients[i].type = HOSTIF_CLIENT_V6 ;          
00581           }
00582         }
00583       else if( ((error = nfs_LookupNetworkAddr(client_hostname,
00584                                                (unsigned long *) &netAddr,
00585                                                (unsigned long *) &netMask) ) ) == 0 )
00586         {
00587           /* Entry is a network definition */
00588           p_clients[i].client.network.netaddr = netAddr ;
00589           p_clients[i].options |= EXPORT_OPTION_NETENT ;
00590           p_clients[i].client.network.netmask = netMask;
00591           p_clients[i].type = NETWORK_CLIENT ;
00592           
00593 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                    
00594           printf("----------------- %s to network %s = %d.%d.%d.%d\n",
00595               (option==EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT ? "Root-access":"Access"), 
00596               client_hostname, (unsigned int)(p_clients[i].client.network.netaddr >> 24),
00597               (unsigned int)((p_clients[i].client.network.netaddr >> 16)&0xFF),
00598               (unsigned int)((p_clients[i].client.network.netaddr >> 8)&0xFF),
00599               (unsigned int)(p_clients[i].client.network.netaddr & 0xFF));
00600 #endif
00601         }
00602       else
00603         {
00604           /* this may be  a wildcarded host */
00605           /* Lookup into the string to see if it contains '*' or '?' */
00606           is_wildcarded_host = FALSE ;
00607           for( l = 0 ; l < strlen( client_hostname ) ; l++ )
00608             {
00609               if( ( client_hostname[l] == '*' ) ||
00610                   ( client_hostname[l] == '?' ) )
00611                 {
00612                   is_wildcarded_host = TRUE ;
00613                   break ;
00614                 }
00615             }
00616           
00617           if( is_wildcarded_host == TRUE )
00618             {
00619               p_clients[i].type = WILDCARDHOST_CLIENT ;
00620               strncpy(  p_clients[i].client.wildcard.wildcard,  client_hostname, MAXHOSTNAMELEN ) ;
00621               
00622 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                    
00623               printf("----------------- %s to wildcard %s\n",
00624               (option==EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT ? "Root-access":"Access"), client_hostname);
00625 #endif
00626             }
00627           else
00628             {
00629               /* Last case: type for client could not be identified. This should not occur */
00630               printf( "Unsupported type for client %s\n", client_hostname ) ;
00631             }
00632         }
00633     }   /* for i */
00634   
00635         /* Before we finish, do not forget to set the new number of clients
00636    * and the new pointer to client array.
00637    */
00638         ExportEntry->clients.num_clients += new_clients_number ;
00639 
00640         return 0;               /* success !! */
00641 }                               /* nfs_AddClientsToExportList */

00647   DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: WARNING: %s defined twice !!! (ignored)", _str_ )

00650 
00656 static int BuildExportEntry( config_item_t block,
00657                              exportlist_t ** pp_export )
00658 {
00659   /* limites for nfs_ParseConfLine */
00660   #define EXPORT_MAX_CLIENTS   EXPORTS_NB_MAX_CLIENTS /* number of clients */
00661   #define EXPORT_MAX_CLIENTLEN 256 /* client name len */
00662 
00663   exportlist_t * p_entry;
00664   int i, rc;
00665   char * var_name;
00666   char * var_value;
00667   
00668   /* the mandatory options */
00669   
00670   unsigned int mandatory_options =
00671       ( FLAG_EXPORT_ID | FLAG_EXPORT_PATH |
00672         FLAG_EXPORT_ROOT_OR_ACCESS | FLAG_EXPORT_PSEUDO );
00673 
00674   /* the given options */
00675   
00676   unsigned int set_options = 0;
00677   
00678   int err_flag = FALSE;
00679     
00680   /* allocates export entry */
00681   p_entry = (exportlist_t *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof( exportlist_t ));
00682   
00683   
00684   if ( p_entry == NULL ) return Mem_Errno;
00685     
00688   p_entry->next                = NULL;
00689   p_entry->options             = 0;
00690   p_entry->status              = EXPORTLIST_OK ;
00691   p_entry->clients.num_clients = 0 ;
00692   p_entry->access_type         = ACCESSTYPE_RW ;  
00693   p_entry->anonymous_uid       = (uid_t)-2;
00694   p_entry->MaxOffsetWrite      = (fsal_off_t)0 ;
00695   p_entry->MaxOffsetRead       = (fsal_off_t)0 ;
00696   p_entry->MaxCacheSize        = (fsal_off_t)0 ;
00697   
00698   /* by default, we support auth_none and auth_sys */
00699   p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_AUTH_NONE | EXPORT_OPTION_AUTH_UNIX ;
00700 
00701   /* by default, we support both NFS versions and transport protocols */
00702   p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV2 | EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV3 | EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV4 ;
00703   p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_UDP | EXPORT_OPTION_TCP ;
00704   
00705   p_entry->filesystem_id.major = (fsal_u64_t)666;
00706   p_entry->filesystem_id.minor = (fsal_u64_t)666;  
00707 
00709   p_entry->MaxWrite = (fsal_size_t)4096 ;
00710   p_entry->MaxRead  = (fsal_size_t)4096 ;
00711 
00712   strcpy( p_entry->FS_specific, "" );
00713   strcpy( p_entry->FS_tag, "" ); 
00714       
00715   /* parse options for this export entry */
00716   
00717   for (i=0; i<config_GetNbItems( block ) ; i++)
00718   {
00719     config_item_t item;
00720     
00721     item = config_GetItemByIndex( block, i );
00722    
00723     /* get var name and value */
00724     rc = config_GetKeyValue( item, &var_name, &var_value );
00725     
00726     if ( (rc != 0) || (var_value == NULL) )
00727     {
00728       Mem_Free( p_entry );
00729       DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: internal error %d", rc );
00730       /* free the entry before exiting */
00731       return -1;
00732     }
00733     
00734     if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_ID ) )
00735     {
00736       
00737       long int export_id ;
00738       char * end_ptr;
00739 
00740       /* check if it has not already been set */
00741       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_ID ) == FLAG_EXPORT_ID )
00742       {
00743         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_ID );
00744         continue;
00745       }
00746             
00747       /* parse and check export_id */
00748       errno = 0;      
00749       export_id = strtol( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
00750       
00751       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
00752       {
00753         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid export_id: \"%s\"", var_value );
00754         err_flag = TRUE;
00755         continue;
00756       }
00757       
00758       if ( export_id <= 0 || export_id > USHRT_MAX )
00759       {
00760         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Export_id out of range: \"%ld\"", export_id );
00761         err_flag = TRUE;
00762         continue;
00763       }
00764       
00765       /* set export_id */
00766       
00767       p_entry->id = (unsigned short) export_id;      
00768       
00769       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_ID;
00770       
00771     }
00772     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_PATH ) )
00773     {
00774       /* check if it has not already been set */
00775       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_PATH ) == FLAG_EXPORT_PATH )
00776       {
00777         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_PATH );
00778         continue;
00779       }
00780       
00781       if ( *var_value == '\0' )
00782       {
00783         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Empty export path" );
00784         err_flag = TRUE;
00785         continue;
00786       }
00787       
00790       strncpy( p_entry->fullpath, var_value, MAXPATHLEN );
00791       
00793       strncpy(p_entry->dirname, var_value, MAXNAMLEN );
00794       strncpy(p_entry->fsname, "", MAXNAMLEN );
00795       
00796       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_PATH;
00797       
00798     }
00799     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_ROOT ) )
00800     {              
00801       char * expended_node_list;
00802       
00803       /* temp array of clients */
00804       char * client_list[ EXPORT_MAX_CLIENTS ];
00805       int idx;
00806       int count;
00807       
00808       /* expends host[n-m] notations */
00809       count = nodelist_common_condensed2extended_nodelist( var_value, &expended_node_list );
00810       
00811       if ( count <= 0 )
00812       {
00813         err_flag = TRUE;        
00814         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid format for client list in EXPORT::%s definition", var_name );
00815 
00816         continue;
00817       }
00818       else if ( count > EXPORT_MAX_CLIENTS )
00819       {
00820         err_flag = TRUE;        
00821         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Client list too long (%d>%d)",
00822                       count, EXPORT_MAX_CLIENTS );
00823         continue;          
00824       }
00825         
00826       /* allocate clients strings  */
00827       for ( idx = 0; idx < count ; idx++ )
00828       {
00829         client_list[idx] = (char *)Mem_Alloc( EXPORT_MAX_CLIENTLEN );
00830         client_list[idx][0] = '\0';
00831       }
00832       
00833       /*
00834        * Search for coma-separated list of hosts, networks and netgroups
00835        */
00836       rc = nfs_ParseConfLine( client_list, count,
00837                               expended_node_list, find_comma, find_endLine) ;
00838       
00839       /* free the buffer the nodelist module has allocated */
00840       free(expended_node_list);
00841 
00842       if ( rc < 0 )
00843       {
00844         err_flag = TRUE;        
00845         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Client list too long (>%d)",
00846                       count );
00847 
00848         /* free client strings */
00849         for ( idx = 0; idx < count ; idx++ )
00850           Mem_Free( (caddr_t) client_list[idx] );
00851 
00852         continue;
00853       }
00854       
00855       rc = nfs_AddClientsToExportList( p_entry, 
00856                                        rc,
00857                                       (char **)client_list, 
00858                                        EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT );
00859       
00860       if ( rc != 0 )
00861       {
00862         err_flag = TRUE;
00863         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid client found in \"%s\"",
00864                     var_value );
00865 
00866         /* free client strings */
00867         for ( idx = 0; idx < count ; idx++ )
00868           Mem_Free( (caddr_t) client_list[idx] );
00869 
00870         continue;
00871       }
00872       
00873       /* everything is OK */
00874       
00875       /* free client strings */
00876       for ( idx = 0; idx < count ; idx++ )
00877         Mem_Free( (caddr_t) client_list[idx] );
00878       
00879       /* Notice that as least one of the two options
00880        * Root_Access or access has been specified.
00881        */
00882       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_ROOT_OR_ACCESS;
00883       
00884     }
00885     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_ACCESS ) )
00886     {
00887       char * expended_node_list;
00888 
00889       /* array of clients */
00890       char * client_list[ EXPORT_MAX_CLIENTS ];
00891       int idx;
00892       int count;
00893       
00894       /* expends host[n-m] notations */
00895       count = nodelist_common_condensed2extended_nodelist( var_value, &expended_node_list );
00896       
00897       if ( count <= 0 )
00898       {
00899         err_flag = TRUE;        
00900         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid format for client list in EXPORT::%s definition", var_name );
00901 
00902         continue;
00903       }      
00904       else if ( count > EXPORT_MAX_CLIENTS )
00905       {
00906         err_flag = TRUE;        
00907         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Client list too long (%d>%d)",
00908                       count, EXPORT_MAX_CLIENTS );
00909         continue;          
00910       }
00911       
00912       
00913       /* allocate clients strings  */
00914       for ( idx = 0; idx < count ; idx++ )
00915       {
00916         client_list[idx] = (char *)Mem_Alloc( EXPORT_MAX_CLIENTLEN );
00917         client_list[idx][0] = '\0';
00918       }
00919       
00920       /*
00921        * Search for coma-separated list of hosts, networks and netgroups
00922        */
00923       rc = nfs_ParseConfLine( client_list, count,
00924                               expended_node_list, find_comma, find_endLine) ;
00925       
00926       /* free the buffer the nodelist module has allocated */
00927       free(expended_node_list);
00928 
00929       
00930       if ( rc < 0 )
00931       {
00932         err_flag = TRUE;        
00933         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Client list too long (>%d)",
00934                       count );
00935 
00936         /* free client strings */
00937         for ( idx = 0; idx < count ; idx++ )
00938           Mem_Free( (caddr_t) client_list[idx] );
00939 
00940         continue;
00941       }
00942       
00943       rc = nfs_AddClientsToExportList( p_entry, rc,
00944                                       (char **)client_list, EXPORT_OPTION_ACCESS );
00945       
00946       if ( rc != 0 )
00947       {
00948         err_flag = TRUE;
00949         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid client found in \"%s\"",
00950                     var_value );
00951 
00952         /* free client strings */
00953         for ( idx = 0; idx < count ; idx++ )
00954           Mem_Free( (caddr_t) client_list[idx] );
00955 
00956         continue;
00957       }
00958       
00959       /* everything is OK */
00960       
00961       /* free client strings */
00962       for ( idx = 0; idx < count ; idx++ )
00963         Mem_Free( (caddr_t) client_list[idx] );
00964       
00965       /* Notice that as least one of the two options
00966        * Root_Access or access has been specified.
00967        */
00968       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_ROOT_OR_ACCESS;
00969       
00970     }
00971     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_PSEUDO ) )
00972     {
00973       
00974       /* check if it has not already been set */
00975       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_PSEUDO ) == FLAG_EXPORT_PSEUDO )
00976       {
00977         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_PSEUDO );
00978         continue;
00979       }
00980       
00981       if ( *var_value != '/' )
00982       {
00983         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Pseudo path must begin with a slash (invalid pseudo path: %s).", var_value );
00984         err_flag = TRUE;
00985         continue;
00986       }
00987       
00988       strncpy( p_entry->pseudopath, var_value, MAXPATHLEN );
00989       
00990       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_PSEUDO;
00991       p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_PSEUDO;
00992       
00993     }
00994     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_ACCESSTYPE ) )
00995     {
00996       
00997       /* check if it has not already been set */
00998       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_ACCESSTYPE ) == FLAG_EXPORT_ACCESSTYPE )
00999       {
01000         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING(  CONF_EXPORT_ACCESSTYPE );
01001         continue;
01002       }
01003       
01004       if ( ! STRCMP( var_value, "RW" ) )
01005       {
01006         p_entry->access_type = ACCESSTYPE_RW;
01007       }
01008       else if ( ! STRCMP( var_value, "RO" ) )
01009       {
01010         p_entry->access_type = ACCESSTYPE_RO;
01011       }
01012       else if ( ! STRCMP( var_value, "MDONLY" ) )
01013       {
01014         p_entry->access_type = ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY;
01015       }
01016       else if ( ! STRCMP( var_value, "MDONLY_RO" ) )
01017       {
01018         p_entry->access_type = ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY_RO;
01019       }
01020       else
01021       {
01022         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid access type \"%s\". Values can be: RW, RO, MDONLY, MDONLY_RO.", var_value );
01023         err_flag = TRUE;
01024         continue;
01025       }
01026       
01027       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_ACCESSTYPE;
01028       
01029     }
01030     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_NFS_PROTO ) )
01031     {
01032       
01033 #     define MAX_NFSPROTO      10  /* large enough !!! */
01034 #     define MAX_NFSPROTO_LEN  256 /* so is it !!! */
01035       
01036       char * nfsvers_list[ MAX_NFSPROTO ];
01037       int idx,count;
01038       
01039       
01040       /* check if it has not already been set */
01041       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_NFS_PROTO ) == FLAG_EXPORT_NFS_PROTO )
01042       {
01043         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_NFS_PROTO );
01044         continue;
01045       }
01046       
01047       /* reset nfs proto flags (clean defaults) */
01048       p_entry->options &= ~( EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV2
01049                              | EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV3
01050                              | EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV4 );
01051 
01052       
01053       /* allocate nfs vers strings */
01054       for ( idx = 0; idx < MAX_NFSPROTO ; idx++ )
01055         nfsvers_list[idx] = (char *)Mem_Alloc( MAX_NFSPROTO_LEN );
01056       
01057       /*
01058        * Search for coma-separated list of nfsprotos
01059        */
01060       count = nfs_ParseConfLine( nfsvers_list, MAX_NFSPROTO,
01061                               var_value, find_comma, find_endLine ) ;
01062       
01063       if ( count < 0 )
01064       {
01065         err_flag = TRUE;        
01066         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: NFS protocols list too long (>%d)",
01067                       MAX_NFSPROTO );
01068 
01069         /* free sec strings */
01070         for ( idx = 0; idx < MAX_NFSPROTO ; idx++ )
01071           Mem_Free( (caddr_t) nfsvers_list[idx] );
01072 
01073         continue;
01074       }
01075       
01076       /* add each Nfs protocol flag to the option field.  */
01077       
01078       for ( idx = 0; idx < count; idx++ )
01079       {
01080         if ( ! STRCMP( nfsvers_list[idx], "2" ) )
01081         {
01082           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV2;
01083         }
01084         else if ( ! STRCMP( nfsvers_list[idx], "3" ) )
01085         {
01086           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV3;
01087         }
01088         else if ( ! STRCMP( nfsvers_list[idx], "4" ) )
01089         {
01090           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV4;
01091         }
01092         else
01093         {
01094           DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid NFS version \"%s\". Values can be: 2, 3, 4.", nfsvers_list[idx] );
01095           err_flag = TRUE;
01096         }
01097       }
01098       
01099       /* free sec strings */
01100       for ( idx = 0; idx < MAX_NFSPROTO ; idx++ )
01101         Mem_Free( (caddr_t) nfsvers_list[idx] );
01102 
01103       /* check that at least one nfs protocol has been specified */      
01104       if ( ( p_entry->options & ( EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV2
01105                                 | EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV3
01106                                 | EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV4 )) == 0 )
01107         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: WARNING: /!\\ Empty NFS_protocols list" );
01108       
01109       
01110       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_NFS_PROTO;      
01111       
01112     }
01113     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_TRANS_PROTO ) )
01114     {
01115       
01116 #     define MAX_TRANSPROTO      10  /* large enough !!! */
01117 #     define MAX_TRANSPROTO_LEN  256 /* so is it !!! */
01118       
01119       char * transproto_list[ MAX_TRANSPROTO ];
01120       int idx,count;
01121       
01122       
01123       /* check if it has not already been set */
01124       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_TRANS_PROTO ) == FLAG_EXPORT_TRANS_PROTO )
01125       {
01126         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_TRANS_PROTO );
01127         continue;
01128       }
01129       
01130       /* reset TRANS proto flags (clean defaults) */
01131       p_entry->options &= ~( EXPORT_OPTION_UDP | EXPORT_OPTION_TCP );
01132 
01133       
01134       /* allocate TRANS vers strings */
01135       for ( idx = 0; idx < MAX_TRANSPROTO ; idx++ )
01136         transproto_list[idx] = (char *)Mem_Alloc( MAX_TRANSPROTO_LEN );
01137       
01138       /*
01139        * Search for coma-separated list of TRANSprotos
01140        */
01141       count = nfs_ParseConfLine( transproto_list, MAX_TRANSPROTO,
01142                               var_value, find_comma, find_endLine ) ;
01143       
01144       if ( count < 0 )
01145       {
01146         err_flag = TRUE;        
01147         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Protocol list too long (>%d)",
01148                       MAX_TRANSPROTO );
01149 
01150         /* free sec strings */
01151         for ( idx = 0; idx < MAX_TRANSPROTO ; idx++ )
01152           Mem_Free( (caddr_t) transproto_list[idx] );
01153 
01154         continue;
01155       }
01156       
01157       /* add each TRANS protocol flag to the option field.  */
01158       
01159       for ( idx = 0; idx < count; idx++ )
01160       {
01161         if ( ! STRCMP( transproto_list[idx], "UDP" ) )
01162         {
01163           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_UDP;
01164         }
01165         else if ( ! STRCMP( transproto_list[idx], "TCP" ) )
01166         {
01167           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_TCP;
01168         }
01169         else
01170         {
01171           DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid protocol \"%s\". Values can be: UDP, TCP.", transproto_list[idx] );
01172           err_flag = TRUE;
01173         }
01174       }
01175       
01176       /* free sec strings */
01177       for ( idx = 0; idx < MAX_TRANSPROTO ; idx++ )
01178         Mem_Free( (caddr_t) transproto_list[idx] );
01179 
01180       /* check that at least one TRANS protocol has been specified */      
01181       if ( ( p_entry->options & ( EXPORT_OPTION_UDP
01182                                 | EXPORT_OPTION_TCP )) == 0 )
01183         DisplayLog( "TRANS READ_EXPORT: WARNING: /!\\ Empty protocol list" );      
01184       
01185       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_TRANS_PROTO;
01186       
01187     }
01188     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_ANON_ROOT ) )
01189     {
01190       
01191       long int anon_uid ;
01192       char * end_ptr;
01193       
01194       /* check if it has not already been set */
01195       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_ANON_ROOT ) == FLAG_EXPORT_ANON_ROOT )
01196       {
01197         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_ANON_ROOT );
01198         continue;
01199       }
01200       
01201       /* parse and check anon_uid */
01202       errno = 0;
01203 
01204       anon_uid = strtol( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
01205       
01206       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
01207       {
01208         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid Anonymous_root_uid: \"%s\"", var_value );
01209         err_flag = TRUE;
01210         continue;
01211       }
01212       
01213       /* set anon_uid */
01214       
01215       p_entry->anonymous_uid = (uid_t) anon_uid;
01216       
01217       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_ANON_ROOT;
01218       
01219     }
01220     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_SECTYPE ) )
01221     {
01222 #     define MAX_SECTYPE      10  /* large enough !!! */
01223 #     define MAX_SECTYPE_LEN  256 /* so is it !!! */
01224       
01225       char * sec_list[ MAX_SECTYPE ];
01226       int idx,count;
01227       
01228       
01229       /* check if it has not already been set */
01230       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_SECTYPE ) == FLAG_EXPORT_SECTYPE )
01231       {
01232         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_SECTYPE );
01233         continue;
01234       }
01235       
01236       /* reset security flags (clean defaults) */
01237       p_entry->options &= ~( EXPORT_OPTION_AUTH_NONE
01238                              | EXPORT_OPTION_AUTH_UNIX
01239                              | EXPORT_OPTION_RPCSEC_GSS_NONE
01240                              | EXPORT_OPTION_RPCSEC_GSS_INTG
01241                              | EXPORT_OPTION_RPCSEC_GSS_PRIV );
01242 
01243       
01244       /* allocate sec strings */
01245       for ( idx = 0; idx < MAX_SECTYPE ; idx++ )
01246         sec_list[idx] = (char *)Mem_Alloc( MAX_SECTYPE_LEN );
01247       
01248       /*
01249        * Search for coma-separated list of sectypes
01250        */
01251       count = nfs_ParseConfLine( sec_list, MAX_SECTYPE,
01252                               var_value, find_comma, find_endLine ) ;
01253       
01254       if ( count < 0 )
01255       {
01256         err_flag = TRUE;        
01257         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: SecType list too long (>%d)",
01258                       MAX_SECTYPE );
01259 
01260         /* free sec strings */
01261         for ( idx = 0; idx < MAX_SECTYPE ; idx++ )
01262           Mem_Free( (caddr_t) sec_list[idx] );
01263 
01264         continue;
01265       }
01266       
01267       /* add each sectype flag to the option field.  */
01268       
01269       for ( idx = 0; idx < count; idx++ )
01270       {
01271         if ( ! STRCMP( sec_list[idx], "none" ) )
01272         {
01273           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_AUTH_NONE;
01274         }
01275         else if ( ! STRCMP( sec_list[idx], "sys" ) )
01276         {
01277           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_AUTH_UNIX;
01278         }
01279         else if ( ! STRCMP( sec_list[idx], "krb5" ) )
01280         {
01281           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_RPCSEC_GSS_NONE;
01282         }
01283         else if ( ! STRCMP( sec_list[idx], "krb5i" ) )
01284         {
01285           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_RPCSEC_GSS_INTG;
01286         }
01287         else if ( ! STRCMP( sec_list[idx], "krb5p" ) )
01288         {
01289           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_RPCSEC_GSS_PRIV;
01290         }    
01291         else
01292         {
01293           DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid SecType \"%s\". Values can be: none, sys, krb5, krb5i, krb5p.", sec_list[idx] );
01294           err_flag = TRUE;
01295         }
01296       }
01297       
01298       /* free sec strings */
01299       for ( idx = 0; idx < MAX_SECTYPE ; idx++ )
01300         Mem_Free( (caddr_t) sec_list[idx] );
01301 
01302       /* check that at least one sectype has been specified */      
01303       if ( ( p_entry->options & ( EXPORT_OPTION_AUTH_NONE
01304                                 | EXPORT_OPTION_AUTH_UNIX
01305                                 | EXPORT_OPTION_RPCSEC_GSS_NONE
01306                                 | EXPORT_OPTION_RPCSEC_GSS_INTG
01307                                 | EXPORT_OPTION_RPCSEC_GSS_PRIV )) == 0 )
01308         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: WARNING: /!\\ Empty SecType" );
01309       
01310       
01311       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_SECTYPE;      
01312       
01313     }
01314     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_MAX_READ ) )
01315     {
01316       long long int size ;
01317       char * end_ptr;
01318       
01319       /* check if it has not already been set */
01320       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_MAX_READ ) == FLAG_EXPORT_MAX_READ )
01321       {
01322         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_MAX_READ );
01323         continue;
01324       }
01325       
01326       errno = 0;
01327       size = strtoll( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
01328       
01329       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
01330       {
01331         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid MaxRead: \"%s\"", var_value );
01332         err_flag = TRUE;
01333         continue;
01334       }
01335       
01336       if ( size < 0 )
01337       {
01338         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: MaxRead out of range: %lld", size );
01339         err_flag = TRUE;
01340         continue;
01341       }
01342       
01343       /* set filesystem_id */
01344       
01345       p_entry->MaxRead = (fsal_size_t) size;
01346       p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_MAXREAD;
01347       
01348       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_MAX_READ;
01349     }
01350     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_MAX_WRITE ) )
01351     {
01352       long long int size ;
01353       char * end_ptr;
01354       
01355       /* check if it has not already been set */
01356       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_MAX_WRITE ) == FLAG_EXPORT_MAX_WRITE )
01357       {
01358         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_MAX_WRITE );
01359         continue;
01360       }
01361       
01362       errno = 0;
01363       size = strtoll( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
01364       
01365       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
01366       {
01367         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid MaxWrite: \"%s\"", var_value );
01368         err_flag = TRUE;
01369         continue;
01370       }
01371       
01372       if ( size < 0 )
01373       {
01374         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: MaxWrite out of range: %lld", size );
01375         err_flag = TRUE;
01376         continue;
01377       }
01378       
01379       /* set filesystem_id */
01380       
01381       p_entry->MaxWrite = (fsal_size_t) size;
01382       p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_MAXWRITE;
01383       
01384       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_MAX_WRITE;
01385     }
01386     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_PREF_READ ) )
01387     {
01388       long long int size ;
01389       char * end_ptr;
01390       
01391       /* check if it has not already been set */
01392       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_READ ) == FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_READ )
01393       {
01394         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_PREF_READ );
01395         continue;
01396       }
01397       
01398       errno = 0;
01399       size = strtoll( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
01400       
01401       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
01402       {
01403         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid PrefRead: \"%s\"", var_value );
01404         err_flag = TRUE;
01405         continue;
01406       }
01407       
01408       if ( size < 0 )
01409       {
01410         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: PrefRead out of range: %lld", size );
01411         err_flag = TRUE;
01412         continue;
01413       }
01414       
01415       /* set filesystem_id */
01416       
01417       p_entry->PrefRead = (fsal_size_t) size;
01418       p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_PREFREAD;
01419       
01420       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_READ;
01421     }
01422     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_PREF_WRITE ) )
01423     {
01424       long long int size ;
01425       char * end_ptr;
01426       
01427       /* check if it has not already been set */
01428       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_WRITE ) == FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_WRITE )
01429       {
01430         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_PREF_WRITE );
01431         continue;
01432       }
01433       
01434       errno = 0;
01435       size = strtoll( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
01436       
01437       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
01438       {
01439         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid PrefWrite: \"%s\"", var_value );
01440         err_flag = TRUE;
01441         continue;
01442       }
01443       
01444       if ( size < 0 )
01445       {
01446         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: PrefWrite out of range: %lld", size );
01447         err_flag = TRUE;
01448         continue;
01449       }
01450       
01451       /* set filesystem_id */
01452       
01453       p_entry->PrefWrite = (fsal_size_t) size;
01454       p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_PREFWRITE;
01455       
01456       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_WRITE;
01457     }
01458     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_PREF_READDIR ) )
01459     {
01460       long long int size ;
01461       char * end_ptr;
01462       
01463       /* check if it has not already been set */
01464       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_READDIR ) == FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_READDIR )
01465       {
01466         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_PREF_READDIR );
01467         continue;
01468       }
01469       
01470       errno = 0;
01471       size = strtoll( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
01472       
01473       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
01474       {
01475         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid PrefReaddir: \"%s\"", var_value );
01476         err_flag = TRUE;
01477         continue;
01478       }
01479       
01480       if ( size < 0 )
01481       {
01482         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: PrefReaddir out of range: %lld", size );
01483         err_flag = TRUE;
01484         continue;
01485       }
01486       
01487       /* set filesystem_id */
01488       
01489       p_entry->PrefReaddir = (fsal_size_t) size;
01490       p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_PREFRDDIR;
01491       
01492       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_READDIR;
01493     }
01494     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_PREF_WRITE ) )
01495     {
01496       long long int size ;
01497       char * end_ptr;
01498       
01499       /* check if it has not already been set */
01500       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_WRITE ) == FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_WRITE )
01501       {
01502         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_PREF_WRITE );
01503         continue;
01504       }
01505       
01506       errno = 0;
01507       size = strtoll( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
01508       
01509       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
01510       {
01511         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid PrefWrite: \"%s\"", var_value );
01512         err_flag = TRUE;
01513         continue;
01514       }
01515       
01516       if ( size < 0 )
01517       {
01518         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: PrefWrite out of range: %lld", size );
01519         err_flag = TRUE;
01520         continue;
01521       }
01522       
01523       /* set filesystem_id */
01524       
01525       p_entry->PrefWrite = (fsal_size_t) size;
01526       p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_PREFWRITE;
01527       
01528       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_PREF_WRITE;
01529 
01530     }
01531     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_FSID ) )
01532     {
01533       long long int major, minor ;
01534       char * end_ptr;
01535       
01536       /* check if it has not already been set */
01537       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_FSID ) == FLAG_EXPORT_FSID )
01538       {
01539         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_FSID );
01540         continue;
01541       }
01542       
01543       /* parse and check filesystem id */
01544       errno = 0;
01545       major = strtoll( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
01546       
01547       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '.' || errno != 0 )
01548       {
01549         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid filesystem_id: \"%s\"", var_value );
01550         err_flag = TRUE;
01551         continue;
01552       }
01553       
01554       end_ptr++; /* the first character after the dot */
01555       
01556       errno = 0;
01557       minor = strtoll( end_ptr, &end_ptr, 10 );
01558       
01559       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
01560       {
01561         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid filesystem_id: \"%s\"", var_value );
01562         err_flag = TRUE;
01563         continue;
01564       }
01565       
01566       if ( major < 0  || minor < 0 )
01567       {
01568         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: filesystem_id out of range: %lld.%lld", major, minor );
01569         err_flag = TRUE;
01570         continue;
01571       }
01572       
01573       /* set filesystem_id */
01574       
01575       p_entry->filesystem_id.major = (fsal_u64_t) major;
01576       p_entry->filesystem_id.minor = (fsal_u64_t) minor;
01577       
01578       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_FSID;
01579       
01580     }
01581     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_NOSUID ) )
01582     {
01583       /* check if it has not already been set */
01584       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_NOSUID ) == FLAG_EXPORT_NOSUID )
01585       {
01586         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_NOSUID );
01587         continue;
01588       }
01589       
01590       switch( StrToBoolean ( var_value ) )
01591       {
01592         case 1:
01593           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_NOSUID;
01594           break;
01595           
01596         case 0:
01597           /*default (false)*/
01598           break;
01599           
01600         default: /* error */
01601         {
01602           DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid value for %s (%s): TRUE or FALSE expected.",var_name, var_value );
01603           err_flag = TRUE;
01604           continue;
01605         }
01606       }
01607       
01608       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_NOSUID;
01609       
01610     }
01611     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_NOSGID ) )
01612     {
01613       /* check if it has not already been set */
01614       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_NOSGID ) == FLAG_EXPORT_NOSGID )
01615       {
01616         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_NOSGID );
01617         continue;
01618       }
01619       
01620       switch( StrToBoolean ( var_value ) )
01621       {
01622         case 1:
01623           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_NOSGID;
01624           break;
01625           
01626         case 0:
01627           /*default (false)*/
01628           break;
01629         
01630         default: /* error */
01631           DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid value for %s (%s): TRUE or FALSE expected.",var_name, var_value );
01632           err_flag = TRUE;
01633           continue;
01634       }
01635       
01636       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_NOSGID;
01637     }
01638     else if(  ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_PRIVILEGED_PORT ) )
01639     {
01640       /* check if it has not already been set */
01641       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_PRIVILEGED_PORT ) == FLAG_EXPORT_PRIVILEGED_PORT )
01642       {
01643         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( FLAG_EXPORT_PRIVILEGED_PORT );
01644         continue;
01645       }
01646       
01647       switch( StrToBoolean ( var_value ) )
01648         {
01649         case 1:
01650           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_PRIVILEGED_PORT ;
01651           break;
01652 
01653         case 0:
01654           /*default (false)*/
01655           break;
01656 
01657         default: /* error */
01658           DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid value for '%s' (%s): TRUE or FALSE expected.", var_name, var_value );
01659           err_flag = TRUE;
01660           continue;
01661         }
01662       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_PRIVILEGED_PORT ;
01663     }
01664     else if(  ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_USE_DATACACHE ) ) 
01665     {
01666       /* check if it has not already been set */
01667       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_USE_DATACACHE ) == FLAG_EXPORT_USE_DATACACHE )
01668       {
01669         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( FLAG_EXPORT_USE_DATACACHE );
01670         continue;
01671       }
01672       
01673       switch( StrToBoolean ( var_value ) )
01674         {
01675         case 1:
01676           p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_USE_DATACACHE ;
01677           break;
01678 
01679         case 0:
01680           /*default (false)*/
01681           break;
01682 
01683         default: /* error */
01684           DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid value for '%s' (%s): TRUE or FALSE expected.", var_name,var_value );
01685           err_flag = TRUE;
01686           continue;
01687         }
01688       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_USE_DATACACHE ;
01689     }
01690     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_FS_SPECIFIC ) )
01691     {
01692       /* check if it has not already been set */
01693       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_FS_SPECIFIC) == FLAG_EXPORT_FS_SPECIFIC )
01694       {
01695         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_FS_SPECIFIC );
01696         continue;
01697       }
01698       
01699       strncpy( p_entry->FS_specific, var_value, MAXPATHLEN );
01700       
01701       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_FS_SPECIFIC;
01702       
01703     }
01704     else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_FS_TAG ) )
01705     {
01706       /* check if it has not already been set */
01707       if ( ( set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_FS_TAG) == FLAG_EXPORT_FS_TAG )
01708       {
01709         DEFINED_TWICE_WARNING( CONF_EXPORT_FS_TAG );
01710         continue;
01711       }
01712 
01713       strncpy( p_entry->FS_tag, var_value, MAXPATHLEN );
01714 
01715       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_FS_TAG;
01716 
01717     }
01718    else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_MAX_OFF_WRITE ) )
01719     {
01720       long long int offset ;
01721       char * end_ptr;
01722       
01723       
01724       errno = 0;
01725       offset = strtoll( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
01726       
01727       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
01728       {
01729         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid MaxOffsetWrite: \"%s\"", var_value );
01730         err_flag = TRUE;
01731         continue;
01732       }
01733       
01734       /* set filesystem_id */
01735       
01736       p_entry->MaxOffsetWrite = (fsal_size_t) offset;
01737       p_entry->options  |= EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETWRITE ;
01738 
01739       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_MAX_OFF_WRITE ;
01740 
01741     }
01742    else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_MAX_CACHE_SIZE ) )
01743     {
01744       long long int offset ;
01745       char * end_ptr;
01746       
01747       
01748       errno = 0;
01749       offset = strtoll( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
01750       
01751       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
01752       {
01753         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid MaxCacheSize: \"%s\"", var_value );
01754         err_flag = TRUE;
01755         continue;
01756       }
01757       
01758       /* set filesystem_id */
01759       
01760       p_entry->MaxCacheSize = (fsal_size_t) offset;
01761       p_entry->options  |= EXPORT_OPTION_MAXCACHESIZE ;
01762 
01763       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_MAX_CACHE_SIZE ;
01764 
01765     }
01766      else if ( ! STRCMP( var_name, CONF_EXPORT_MAX_OFF_READ ) )
01767     {
01768       long long int offset ;
01769       char * end_ptr;
01770       
01771       
01772       errno = 0;
01773       offset = strtoll( var_value, &end_ptr, 10 );
01774       
01775       if ( end_ptr == NULL || *end_ptr != '\0' || errno != 0 )
01776       {
01777         DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid MaxOffsetRead: \"%s\"", var_value );
01778         err_flag = TRUE;
01779         continue;
01780       }
01781       
01782       /* set filesystem_id */
01783       
01784       p_entry->MaxOffsetRead = (fsal_size_t) offset;
01785       p_entry->options  |= EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETREAD ;
01786 
01787       set_options |= FLAG_EXPORT_MAX_OFF_READ ;
01788 
01789     }
01790     else
01791     {
01792       DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: WARNING: Unknown option: %s", var_name );
01793     }
01794      
01795   }
01796   
01797   
01800   if ( ( set_options & mandatory_options ) != mandatory_options )
01801   {    
01802     if ( (set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_ID ) != FLAG_EXPORT_ID ) 
01803       DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Missing mandatory parameter %s",CONF_EXPORT_ID );
01804     
01805     if ( (set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_PATH ) != FLAG_EXPORT_PATH )
01806       DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Missing mandatory parameter %s",CONF_EXPORT_PATH );
01807     
01808 
01809     if ( (set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_ROOT_OR_ACCESS ) != FLAG_EXPORT_ROOT_OR_ACCESS )
01810       DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Missing mandatory parameter %s or %s",
01811           CONF_EXPORT_ROOT, CONF_EXPORT_ACCESS );
01812     
01813     if ( (set_options & FLAG_EXPORT_PSEUDO ) != FLAG_EXPORT_PSEUDO )
01814       DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Missing mandatory parameter %s", CONF_EXPORT_PSEUDO );
01815         
01816     err_flag = TRUE;    
01817   }
01818   
01819   /* check if there had any error.
01820    * if so, free the p_entry and return an error.
01821    */
01822   if ( err_flag )
01823   {
01824     Mem_Free( p_entry );
01825     return -1;
01826   }
01827   
01828   *pp_export = p_entry;
01829   
01830   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT,
01831       "NFS READ_EXPORT: Export %d (%s) successfully parsed",
01832       p_entry->id, p_entry->fullpath );
01833   
01834   return 0;
01835   
01836 }
01837 
01838 
01839 
01845 static  char * client_root_access [] = { "*" };
01846 
01847 
01848 exportlist_t * BuildDefaultExport()
01849 {
01850   exportlist_t * p_entry;
01851   int rc;
01852     
01853   /* allocates new export entry */
01854   p_entry = (exportlist_t *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof( exportlist_t ));
01855   
01856   if ( p_entry == NULL ) return NULL;
01857   
01860   p_entry->next                = NULL;
01861   p_entry->options             = 0;
01862   p_entry->status              = EXPORTLIST_OK ;
01863   p_entry->clients.num_clients = 0 ;
01864   p_entry->access_type         = ACCESSTYPE_RW ;  
01865   p_entry->anonymous_uid       = (uid_t)-2;
01866   p_entry->MaxOffsetWrite      = (fsal_off_t)0 ;
01867   p_entry->MaxOffsetRead       = (fsal_off_t)0 ;
01868   p_entry->MaxCacheSize        = (fsal_off_t)0 ;
01869   
01870   /* by default, we support auth_none and auth_sys */
01871   p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_AUTH_NONE | EXPORT_OPTION_AUTH_UNIX ;
01872 
01873   /* by default, we support both NFS versions and transport protocols */
01874   p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV2 | EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV3 | EXPORT_OPTION_NFSV4 ;
01875   p_entry->options |= EXPORT_OPTION_UDP | EXPORT_OPTION_TCP ;
01876   
01877   p_entry->filesystem_id.major = (fsal_u64_t)101;
01878   p_entry->filesystem_id.minor = (fsal_u64_t)101;  
01879 
01881   p_entry->MaxWrite = (fsal_size_t)4096 ;
01882   p_entry->MaxRead  = (fsal_size_t)4096 ;
01883 
01884   strcpy( p_entry->FS_specific, "" );
01885   strcpy( p_entry->FS_tag, "ganesha" );
01886     
01887   p_entry->id = 1;
01888   
01889   strcpy( p_entry->fullpath, "/" );      
01890   strcpy(p_entry->dirname, "/" );
01891   strcpy(p_entry->fsname, "" );
01892   strcpy( p_entry->pseudopath, "/" );
01893         
01897   rc = nfs_AddClientsToExportList( p_entry, 
01898                                   1,
01899                                   client_root_access,
01900                                   EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT );
01901       
01902   if ( rc != 0 )
01903   {
01904     DisplayLog( "NFS READ_EXPORT: ERROR: Invalid client \"%s\"",
01905                 client_root_access );
01906     return NULL;
01907   }
01908       
01909 
01910   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT,
01911       "NFS READ_EXPORT: Export %d (%s) successfully parsed",
01912       p_entry->id, p_entry->fullpath );
01913   
01914   return p_entry;
01915   
01916 } /* BuildDefaultExport */
01917 
01918 
01919
