01924 
01925 
01926 
01933 int ReadExports ( config_file_t   in_config, /* The file that contains the export list */
01934                   exportlist_t ** ppexportlist ) /* Pointer to the export list */
01935 {
01936 
01937  int nb_blk, rc, i;
01938  char * blk_name;
01939  int err_flag = FALSE;
01940  
01941  exportlist_t * p_export_item;
01942  exportlist_t * p_export_last = NULL ;
01943  
01944  int nb_entries = 0;
01945  
01946  if ( !ppexportlist ) 
01947    return -EFAULT; 
01948   
01949  *ppexportlist = NULL ;
01950  
01951  /* get the number of blocks in the configuration file */
01952  nb_blk = config_GetNbBlocks( in_config );
01953  
01954  if ( nb_blk < 0 ) 
01955    return -1;
01956  
01957  /* Iteration on config file blocks. */
01958  for ( i=0; i< nb_blk; i++ )
01959  {
01960    config_item_t block;
01961      
01962    block = config_GetBlockByIndex( in_config, i );
01963 
01964    if ( block == NULL ) return -1;
01965    
01966    /* get the name of the block */
01967    blk_name = config_GetBlockName( block );
01968    
01969    if ( blk_name == NULL ) return -1;
01970    
01971    if ( ! STRCMP( blk_name, CONF_LABEL_EXPORT ) )
01972    {
01973      
01974      rc = BuildExportEntry( block, &p_export_item );
01975      
01976      /* If the entry is errorneous, ignore it
01977       * and continue checking syntax of other entries.
01978       */
01979      if ( rc != 0 )
01980        {
01981          err_flag = TRUE;
01982          continue;
01983        }
01984      
01985      p_export_item->next = NULL;
01986      
01987      if ( *ppexportlist == NULL )
01988      {
01989        *ppexportlist = p_export_item;
01990      }
01991      else
01992      {
01993        p_export_last->next = p_export_item;
01994      }
01995      p_export_last = p_export_item;
01996 
01997      nb_entries ++;
01998      
01999    }
02000 
02001  }
02002  
02003  if ( err_flag )
02004  { 
02005    return -1;
02006  }
02007  else
02008    return nb_entries;
02009 }
02010 
02014 static int export_client_match( unsigned int                addr,
02015                                 exportlist_t              * pexport,
02016                                 exportlist_client_entry_t * pclient_found,
02017                                 unsigned int                export_option)
02018 {
02019     unsigned int  i ;
02020     int           rc ;
02021     char          hostname[MAXHOSTNAMELEN] ;
02022   
02023 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
02024     if ( export_option & EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT )
02025         printf("Looking for root access entries\n");
02026     if ( export_option & EXPORT_OPTION_ACCESS )
02027         printf("Looking for access only entries\n");
02028 #endif        
02029     
02030     
02031     for( i = 0 ; i < pexport->clients.num_clients ; i++ ) 
02032     {
02033       
02034       /* only match the specified flags */
02035       if ( (pexport->clients.clientarray[i].options & export_option) != export_option )
02036             continue;
02037         
02038       switch( pexport->clients.clientarray[i].type )
02039         {
02040         case HOSTIF_CLIENT:
02041 
02042           if( pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.hostif.clientaddr == addr )
02043             {
02044 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                    
02045               printf("This matches host adress\n");
02046 #endif
02047               *pclient_found = pexport->clients.clientarray[i] ;
02048               return TRUE ;
02049             }
02050           break ;
02051 
02052         case NETWORK_CLIENT:
02053           
02054 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                    
02055           printf( "Test net %d.%d.%d.%d in %d.%d.%d.%d ??\n",(unsigned int)(pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.network.netaddr >> 24),
02056               (unsigned int)((pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.network.netaddr >> 16)&0xFF),
02057               (unsigned int)((pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.network.netaddr >> 8)&0xFF),
02058               (unsigned int)(pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.network.netaddr & 0xFF),
02059               (unsigned int)(addr >> 24),
02060               (unsigned int)(addr >> 16)&0xFF,
02061               (unsigned int)(addr >> 8)&0xFF,
02062               (unsigned int)(addr & 0xFF));
02063 #endif
02064           
02065           if( ( pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.network.netmask & addr)  ==  pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.network.netaddr )
02066             {
02067 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                    
02068               printf("This matches network adress\n");
02069 #endif
02070               *pclient_found = pexport->clients.clientarray[i] ;
02071               return TRUE ;
02072             }
02073           break ;
02074           
02075         case NETGROUP_CLIENT:
02076           /* Try to get the entry from th IP/name cache */
02077           if( ( rc = nfs_ip_name_get( addr, hostname ) ) != IP_NAME_SUCCESS )
02078             {
02079               if( rc == IP_NAME_NOT_FOUND )
02080                 {
02081                   /* IPaddr was not cached, add it to the cache */
02082                   if( nfs_ip_name_add( addr, hostname ) != IP_NAME_SUCCESS )
02083                     {
02084                       /* Major failure, name could not be resolved */
02085                       break ;
02086                     }
02087                 }
02088             }
02089           
02090           /* At this point 'hostname' should contain the name that was found */
02091           if( innetgr(  pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.netgroup.netgroupname, hostname, NULL, NULL ) == 1 )
02092           {
02093             *pclient_found = pexport->clients.clientarray[i] ;
02094             return TRUE ; 
02095           }
02096           break ;
02097           
02098 
02099         case WILDCARDHOST_CLIENT:
02100           /* Try to get the entry from th IP/name cache */
02101           if( ( rc = nfs_ip_name_get( addr, hostname ) ) != IP_NAME_SUCCESS )
02102             {
02103               if( rc == IP_NAME_NOT_FOUND )
02104                 {
02105                   /* IPaddr was not cached, add it to the cache */
02106                   if( nfs_ip_name_add( addr, hostname ) != IP_NAME_SUCCESS )
02107                     {
02108                       /* Major failure, name could not be resolved */
02109 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                    
02110                       printf("Could not resolve addr %u.%u.%u.%u\n",
02111                                   (unsigned int)(addr >> 24),
02112                                   (unsigned int)(addr >> 16)&0xFF,
02113                                   (unsigned int)(addr >> 8)&0xFF,
02114                                   (unsigned int)(addr & 0xFF) );
02115 #endif                        
02116                       break ;
02117                     }
02118                 }
02119             }
02120           
02121 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                    
02122           printf("Wildcarded hostname: testing if '%s' matches '%s'\n",
02123                   hostname, pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.wildcard.wildcard );
02124 #endif                        
02125             
02126             
02127           /* At this point 'hostname' should contain the name that was found */
02128           if( fnmatch(  pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.wildcard.wildcard, hostname, FNM_PATHNAME ) == 0 )
02129           {
02130             *pclient_found = pexport->clients.clientarray[i];
02131             return TRUE ;
02132           }
02133           
02134 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                    
02135           printf("'%s' not matching '%s'\n",
02136               hostname, pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.wildcard.wildcard );
02137 #endif
02138           
02139           break ;
02140           
02141         case GSSPRINCIPAL_CLIENT:
02143           printf( "----------> Unsupported type GSS_PRINCIPAL_CLIENT\n" ) ;
02144           return FALSE ;
02145           break ;
02146           
02147         default:
02148           return FALSE ; /* Should never occurs */
02149           break ;
02150         } /* switch */
02151     } /* for */
02152     
02153     /* no export found for this option */
02154     return FALSE;    
02155     
02156 } /* export_client_match */
02157 
02158 static int export_client_matchv6( struct in6_addr           * paddrv6,
02159                                   exportlist_t              * pexport,
02160                                   exportlist_client_entry_t * pclient_found,
02161                                   unsigned int                export_option)
02162 {
02163     unsigned int  i ;
02164     int           rc ;
02165     char          hostname[MAXHOSTNAMELEN] ;
02166   
02167 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
02168     if ( export_option & EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT )
02169         printf("Looking for root access entries\n");
02170     if ( export_option & EXPORT_OPTION_ACCESS )
02171         printf("Looking for access only entries\n");
02172 #endif        
02173     
02174     
02175     for( i = 0 ; i < pexport->clients.num_clients ; i++ ) 
02176     {
02177       
02178       /* only match the specified flags */
02179       if ( (pexport->clients.clientarray[i].options & export_option) != export_option )
02180             continue;
02181         
02182       switch( pexport->clients.clientarray[i].type )
02183         {
02184         case HOSTIF_CLIENT:
02185         case NETWORK_CLIENT:
02186         case NETGROUP_CLIENT:
02187         case WILDCARDHOST_CLIENT:
02188         case GSSPRINCIPAL_CLIENT:
02189            break ;         
02190  
02191         case HOSTIF_CLIENT_V6:
02192           if( !memcmp( pexport->clients.clientarray[i].client.hostif.clientaddr6.s6_addr,
02193                        paddrv6->s6_addr, 
02194                        16 ) ) /* Remember that IPv6 address are 128 bits = 16 bytes long */
02195             {
02196 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                    
02197               printf("This matches host adress in IPv6\n");
02198 #endif
02199               *pclient_found = pexport->clients.clientarray[i] ;
02200               return TRUE ;
02201             }
02202 
02203         default:
02204           return FALSE ; /* Should never occurs */
02205           break ;
02206         } /* switch */
02207     } /* for */
02208     
02209     /* no export found for this option */
02210     return FALSE;    
02211     
02212 } /* export_client_matchv6 */
02213 
02214 
02233 int nfs_export_check_access( struct sockaddr_storage   * pssaddr,
02234                              struct svc_req            * ptr_req,
02235                              exportlist_t              * pexport,
02236                              unsigned int                nfs_prog,
02237                              unsigned int                mnt_prog,
02238                              hash_table_t              * ht_ip_stats,
02239                              nfs_ip_stats_t            * ip_stats_pool,
02240                              exportlist_client_entry_t * pclient_found )
02241 {
02242   int                  rc ;
02243   unsigned int         addr ;
02244   struct sockaddr_in * psockaddr_in ;
02245 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
02246   struct sockaddr_in6 * psockaddr_in6 ;
02247 #endif
02248   static char       ten_bytes_all_0[10] ;
02249   static unsigned   two_bytes_all_1 = 0xFFFF ;
02250 
02251   memset( ten_bytes_all_0, 0, 10 ) ;
02252 
02253   psockaddr_in = (struct sockaddr_in *)pssaddr ;
02254   addr = psockaddr_in->sin_addr.s_addr ;
02255  
02256   /* For now, no matching client is found */
02257   memset( pclient_found, 0, sizeof( exportlist_client_entry_t ));
02258 
02259   /* PROC NULL is always authorized, in all protocols */
02260   if( ptr_req->rq_proc == 0 )
02261     return TRUE ;
02262 
02263   /* If mount protocol is called, just check that AUTH_NONE is not used */
02264   if( ptr_req->rq_prog == mnt_prog )
02265     {
02266       if( ptr_req->rq_cred.oa_flavor != AUTH_NONE ) 
02267         return TRUE ;
02268       else
02269         return FALSE ;
02270     }
02271 
02272 #ifdef _USE_TIPRC_IPV6 
02273   if( psockaddr_in->sin_family == AF_INET )
02274 #endif
02275   /* Increment the stats per client address (for IPv4 Only) */
02276   if( ( rc = nfs_ip_stats_incr( ht_ip_stats, addr, nfs_prog, mnt_prog, ptr_req ) ) == IP_STATS_NOT_FOUND )
02277     {
02278       if( nfs_ip_stats_add( ht_ip_stats, addr, ip_stats_pool ) ==  IP_STATS_SUCCESS )
02279         rc = nfs_ip_stats_incr( ht_ip_stats, addr, nfs_prog, mnt_prog, ptr_req ) ;
02280     }
02281 
02282 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
02283   if( psockaddr_in->sin_family == AF_INET )
02284   {
02285 #endif /* _USE_TIRPC_IPV6 */
02286    /* check if any root access export matches this client */
02287    if ( export_client_match( addr, pexport, pclient_found, EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT ) )
02288        return TRUE;
02289    /* else, check if any access only export matches this client */
02290    else if ( export_client_match( addr, pexport, pclient_found, EXPORT_OPTION_ACCESS ) )
02291        return TRUE;
02292 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
02293   }
02294   else
02295   {
02296      psockaddr_in6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)pssaddr ;
02297 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
02298      char txtaddrv6[100] ;
02299 
02300      inet_ntop( psockaddr_in6->sin6_family,
02301                 psockaddr_in6->sin6_addr.s6_addr,
02302                 txtaddrv6,
02303                 100 ) ;
02304      printf( "Client has IPv6 adress = %s\n", txtaddrv6 ) ;
02305 #endif
02306 
02307      /* If the client socket is IPv4, then it is wrapped into a   ::ffff:a.b.c.d IPv6 address. We check this here 
02308       * This kind of adress is shaped like this:
02309       * |---------------------------------------------------------------|
02310       * |   80 bits = 10 bytes  | 16 bits = 2 bytes | 32 bits = 4 bytes |
02311       * |---------------------------------------------------------------|
02312       * |            0          |        FFFF       |    IPv4 address   | 
02313       * |---------------------------------------------------------------|   */
02314      if( !memcmp( psockaddr_in6->sin6_addr.s6_addr, ten_bytes_all_0, 10 ) &&
02315          !memcmp( (char *)(  psockaddr_in6->sin6_addr.s6_addr + 10 ), (char *)&two_bytes_all_1, 2  ) )
02316       {
02317          /* This is an IPv4 address mapped to an IPv6 one. Extract the IPv4 address and proceed with IPv4 autentication */
02318          memcpy( (char *)&addr, (char *)(  psockaddr_in6->sin6_addr.s6_addr + 12 ), 4 ) ;
02319 
02320          /* Proceed with IPv4 dedicated function */
02321          /* check if any root access export matches this client */
02322            if ( export_client_match( addr, pexport, pclient_found, EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT ) )
02323                return TRUE;
02324            /* else, check if any access only export matches this client */
02325            else if ( export_client_match( addr, pexport, pclient_found, EXPORT_OPTION_ACCESS ) )
02326                return TRUE;
02327       }
02328 
02329      if( export_client_matchv6( &(psockaddr_in6->sin6_addr) , pexport, pclient_found, EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT ) )
02330          return TRUE;
02331      /* else, check if any access only export matches this client */
02332        else if( export_client_matchv6( &(psockaddr_in6->sin6_addr), pexport, pclient_found, EXPORT_OPTION_ACCESS ) )
02333           return TRUE ;
02334   }  
02335 #endif /* _USE_TIRPC_IPV6 */
02336     
02337   /* If this point is reached, no matching entry was found */
02338   return FALSE ;
02339   
02340 } /* nfs_export_check_access */
02341 
02342  
02355 int nfs_export_create_root_entry( exportlist_t *  pexportlist, hash_table_t * ht )
02356 {
02357   static  int               once = 0 ;
02358   exportlist_t            * pcurrent = NULL ;
02359   cache_inode_status_t      cache_status ;
02360 #ifdef _CRASH_RECOVERY_AT_STARTUP
02361   cache_content_status_t    cache_content_status ;
02362 #endif
02363   fsal_status_t             fsal_status ;
02364   cache_inode_fsal_data_t   fsdata ;
02365   fsal_handle_t             fsal_handle ;
02366   fsal_path_t               exportpath_fsal ;
02367   fsal_mdsize_t             strsize = MNTPATHLEN + 1 ;
02368   cache_entry_t           * pentry = NULL ;
02369   fsal_staticfsinfo_t     * pstaticinfo = NULL ;
02370   fsal_op_context_t         context ;
02371   
02372   if( once == 0 )
02373     {
02374       /* setting the 'small_client' structure */
02375       small_client_param.lru_param.nb_entry_prealloc = 10 ;
02376       small_client_param.lru_param.entry_to_str      = local_lru_inode_entry_to_str ;
02377       small_client_param.lru_param.clean_entry       = local_lru_inode_clean_entry ;
02378       small_client_param.nb_prealloc_entry           = 10 ;
02379       small_client_param.nb_pre_dir_data             = 10 ;
02380       small_client_param.nb_pre_parent               = 10 ;
02381       small_client_param.nb_pre_state_v4             = 10 ;
02382       small_client_param.grace_period_link           = 0 ;
02383       small_client_param.grace_period_attr           = 0 ;
02384       small_client_param.grace_period_dirent         = 0 ;
02385       small_client_param.use_test_access             = 1 ;
02386       small_client_param.attrmask                    = FSAL_ATTR_MASK_V2_V3 ; 
02387       
02388       /* creating the 'small_client' */
02389       if( cache_inode_client_init( &small_client, small_client_param, 255, NULL ) )
02390         {
02391           DisplayLog( "NFS_STARTUP: CRITICAL: small cache inode client could not be allocated, exiting..." ) ;
02392           exit ( 1 ) ;
02393         }
02394       else
02395         DisplayLog( "NFS STARTUP: small cache inode client successfully inited" ) ;
02396 
02397       /* creating the datacache client for recovering data cache */
02398       if( cache_content_client_init( &recover_datacache_client, nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param )  )
02399         {
02400            DisplayLog( "NFS_STARTUP: CRITICAL: cache content client (for datacache recovery) could not be allocated, exiting..." ) ;
02401            exit( 1 ) ;
02402         }
02403 
02404       /* Link together the small client and the recover_datacache_client */
02405       small_client.pcontent_client = (void *)&recover_datacache_client ;
02406 
02407 
02408 
02409       /* Get the context for FSAL super user */
02410       fsal_status =  FSAL_InitClientContext( &context );
02411       
02412       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
02413         {
02414           DisplayLog( "NFS STARTUP: Couldn't get the context for FSAL super user" ) ;
02415           return FALSE ;
02416         }
02417       
02418       /* loop the export list */
02419 
02420       for( pcurrent = pexportlist ; pcurrent != NULL ; pcurrent = pcurrent->next )
02421         {
02422           /* Build the FSAL path */
02423           if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( ( fsal_status = FSAL_str2path( pcurrent->fullpath, 
02424                                                             strsize, 
02425                                                             &exportpath_fsal ) ) ) )
02426                 return FALSE;
02427 
02428           /* inits context for the current export entry */
02429           
02430           fsal_status = FSAL_BuildExportContext( &pcurrent->FS_export_context, &exportpath_fsal, pcurrent->FS_specific  );
02431           
02432           if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
02433             {
02434               DisplayLog( "NFS STARTUP: Couldn't build export context for %s", pcurrent->fullpath ) ;
02435               return FALSE ;
02436             }
02437     
02438           /* get the related client context */
02439           fsal_status =  FSAL_GetClientContext( &context, &pcurrent->FS_export_context , 0, 0, NULL, 0 );
02440       
02441           if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
02442             {
02443               DisplayLog( "NFS STARTUP: Couldn't get the credentials for FSAL super user" ) ;
02444               return FALSE ;
02445             }
02446 
02447           
02448           /* Lookup for the FSAL Path */
02449           if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( ( fsal_status = FSAL_lookupPath( &exportpath_fsal,
02450                                                               &context, 
02451                                                               &fsal_handle, 
02452                                                               NULL ) ) ) )
02453             {
02454               DisplayLog( "NFS STARTUP: Couldn't access the root of the exported namespace, ExportId=%u Path=%s FSAL_ERROR=(%u,%u)",
02455                            pcurrent->id, pcurrent->fullpath, fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
02456               return FALSE ;
02457             }
02458 
02459           /* stores handle to the export entry */
02460 
02461           pcurrent->proot_handle = (fsal_handle_t *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof( fsal_handle_t ) ); 
02462           
02463           if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
02464             {
02465               DisplayLog( "NFS STARTUP: Couldn't allocate memory" ) ;
02466               return FALSE ;
02467             }
02468 
02469           *pcurrent->proot_handle = fsal_handle ;
02470 
02471 
02472           /* Add this entry to the Cache Inode as a "root" entry */
02473           fsdata.handle = fsal_handle ;
02474           fsdata.cookie = 0 ;
02475 
02476           if( ( pentry = cache_inode_make_root( &fsdata, 
02477                                                 ht, 
02478                                                 &small_client,
02479                                                 &context, 
02480                                                 &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
02481             {
02482               DisplayLog( "NFS STARTUP: /!\\ | Error when creating root cached entry for %s, export_id=%d, cache_status=%d", 
02483                           pcurrent->fullpath, pcurrent->id, cache_status ) ;
02484               return FALSE ;
02485             }
02486           else
02487             DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS STARTUP: Added root entry for path %s on export_id=%d",
02488                              pcurrent->fullpath, pcurrent->id ) ;
02489 
02490           /* Get FSAL specific info for this entry */
02491           if( ( pstaticinfo = (fsal_staticfsinfo_t *)Mem_Alloc( ( sizeof( fsal_staticfsinfo_t ) ) ) ) == NULL )
02492                 return FALSE ;
02493 
02494           if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( ( fsal_status = FSAL_static_fsinfo( &fsal_handle, &context, pstaticinfo ) ) ) )
02495                 return FALSE ;
02496 
02497           /* Attach to the exportlist entry */
02498           pcurrent->fs_static_info = pstaticinfo ;
02499 
02500 #ifdef _CRASH_RECOVERY_AT_STARTUP
02501           /* Recover the datacache from a previous crah */
02502           if( pcurrent->options & EXPORT_OPTION_USE_DATACACHE )
02503              {
02504                  DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Recovering Data Cache for export id %u", pcurrent->id ) ;
02505                  if( cache_content_crash_recover( pcurrent->id,
02506                                                   &recover_datacache_client,
02507                                                   &small_client,
02508                                                   ht,
02509                                                   &context,
02510                                                   &cache_content_status ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
02511                    {
02512                        DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Datacache for export id %u is not recoverable: error = %d",
02513                                         pcurrent->id, cache_content_status ) ;
02514                    }
02515              }
02516 
02517 #endif
02518         }
02519 
02520       /* Do not call me again */
02521       once = 1 ;
02522     }
02523  
02524   return TRUE ;
02525 } /* nfs_export_create_root_entry */
